VIDEO RELEASE: Senator Blackburn Praises Pro-Life Movement Following Dobbs Decision
June 24, 2022










WASHINGTON, D.C. – U.S. Senator Marsha Blackburn (R-Tenn.), the sole female Republican member of the Senate Judiciary Committee, praised the pro-life movement following the Supreme Court’s decision in Dobbs v. Jackson Women's Health Organization. 

View or download the video here.
Partial Transcript:
 
Congratulations To All Pro-Life Warriors
 
“For almost 50 years, we’ve taken our stand for life. It’s been against a rising tide of moral decay. But, with courage and dedication, we built a society that cherishes life at all stages. I want to offer my gratitude to the advocates, the lawmakers, the sidewalk counselors, the doctors, and other compassionate hearts who worked so hard to guide America into her post-Roe era.”
 
The Fate Of The Unborn Is Back With The States Where It Belongs
 
“The Supreme Court has confirmed that Roe v. Wade was a blatant act of judicial activism that put the fate of the unborn in the hands of unelected judges. Now, at last, that authority is back with the states where it belongs, and We the People have the power to make our voices heard by voting.”
 
The Work To Affirm The Sanctity Of Life Is Far From Over
 
“On behalf of the 63 million babies we lost to Roe’s culture of death, I call on each of you to keep up the fight. Here in Washington, I will champion the pro-life movement with a resolution reaffirming Congress’ commitment to providing women with the resources they need to choose life, and help their children thrive.”  




https://www.blackburn.senate.gov/2022/6/video-release-senator-blackburn-praises-pro-life-movement-following-dobbs-decision
